thread.title: NBA says Dwight Howard should not have been ejected
thread.title_full: NBA says Dwight Howard should not have been ejected

author: Alec Brzezinski (alec.Brzezinski@performgroup.com)
title: NBA says Dwight Howard should not have been ejected
text:
February 28, 2017 8:49am EST February 28, 2017 8:49am EST Basketball, NBA, News, Atlanta Hawks, English, Dwight Howard Howard was ejected Monday in a 114-98 win against the Celtics. Dwight Howard (Getty Images) 
Updated at 8:49 a.m. ET 
Updated at 8:49 a.m. ET 
The NBA worked quickly in jumping to Dwight Howard's defense after the Hawks center was ejected in Monday night's 114-98 win against the Celtics. 
Howard was ejected late in the third quarterÂ after receiving his second technical foul, for taunting, after hanging on the rim following a massive dunk. The NBA said later Monday night that the play shouldÂ have been ruled "non-unsportsmanlike" and thus not have counted toward an automatic ejection. 
Howard finished with 17 points and 12 rebounds in 28 minutes of action. 
"Despite me getting kicked out, I think guys really stepped up and played great; it was a good team win," Howard said, via ESPN.com . "I apologized to the guys and told them I need to do a better job of keeping my composure and some other things, and they understood." 
This is what Howard got ejected for, as you can see, it's pretty weak: 2nd: Dwight vs. The Rim đ pic.twitter.com/cpnpPuSMSZ â Bleacher Report (@BleacherReport) February 28, 2017 
Howard then gave hisÂ jersey away as a souvenier. Come on now, Dwight đ pic.twitter.com/j59BJLKsll â Bleacher Report (@BleacherReport) February 28, 2017 Watch This
